column4: 11.1.1 Identify basic analog components (sources, resistors, capacitors, inductors, diodes) and digital components (logic gates, mux, decoders, flip-flops, etc.) and describe their function.;11.1.2. List typical applications for op-amps and transistors.;11.1.3. List applications of analog and digital filters.;11.1.4. List techniques for preventing overheating in circuits.
column5: 11.2.1. Read circuit schematics and explain the functionality of different building blocks and components.;11.2.2. Read a component’s datasheet and explain its key performance metrics, operating conditions, and maximum ratings.;11.2.3. Explain the need of filtering when processing signals and indicate the types of filters used in electronics.;11.2.4. Describe how digital filters work.
column6: 11.3.1. Perform circuit analysis of electric circuits by writing and solving equations (node and loop analysis);11.3.2. Perform circuit simulation by using CAD tools such as Spice;11.3.3. Model problems using mathematical equations and solve them by using software programs such as Matlab-Simulink, Octave, or similar.;11.3.6. Develop firmware for an embedded system by using a tool-chain (C compiler+assembler+linker)
column7: 11.4.2. Perform an statistical analysis to find information about the robustness of a design under component, temperature, and power supply variations.;11.4.3. Analyze the requirements and specifications of an embedded system, and break it down in building blocks to be implemented separately.
column8: 11.5.2. Given a control problem and a set of specifications, design a PID controller.;11.5.3. By applying the top-down method, design an embedded system that integrates digital and/or analog circuits (microcontrollers, FPGAs, sensors, communications, etc).
column9: 11.6.2. Evaluate an electronic circuit based on different performance metrics and verify whether specifications are met or not.

column4: 11.1.1 Identify basic analog components (sources, resistors, capacitors, inductors, diodes) and digital components (logic gates, mux, decoders, flip-flops, etc.) and describe their function.
column5: 11.2.1. Read circuit schematics and explain the functionality of different building blocks and components.;11.2.4. Describe how digital filters work.
column6: 11.3.5. Dimension components, thermal heat sinks, PCB traces, PCB thermal zones in order to avoid overheating.

column4: 11.1.1 Identify basic analog components (sources, resistors, capacitors, inductors, diodes) and digital components (logic gates, mux, decoders, flip-flops, etc.) and describe their function.;11.1.2. List typical applications for op-amps and transistors.;11.1.6. Mention control techniques that are typically used in modern products.;11.1.12. Mention what Design for Excellence (DfX) means, and list its applications in electronics (design for test DfT, design for manufacturability DfM, etc.)

Read a component’s datasheet and explain its key performance metrics, operating conditions, and maximum ratings.;11.2.6. Explain the origin of heating in electronic circuits and indicate measures to avoid overheating.;11.2.12. Explain what object-oriented programming is and what advantages and disadvantages exist when using it in embedded systems.

column8: 11.5.2. Given a control problem and a set of specifications, design a PID controller.
column9: 11.6.1. Based on given requirements or specifications for an application, compare performance metrics of various components from datasheets, and conclude which ones can be used.
